ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A message is a communication that is addressed to a system in order to trigger some action. The result of such an action is an external item or identification.
The role of message can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

A source_item type allows for the designation of an
or a .

An external_source is the identification of a source of product data that is not the EXPRESS schema to which the exchange conforms.
The product data may conform to some other part of this International Standard.
the identification of the external_source.

ext_description.note: This attribute is an upwardly compatible addition to external_source as specified in ISO 10303-41:1994.

ext_description.p:
Each external_source shall be the
in at most one .
ext_description.note:
The
data type is defined in basic_attribute_schema of this part of ISO 10303.
A template for constraining the population of the entity data types defined in the basic_attribute_schema is described in annex E.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An external_source_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
with a description of their relationship.
The role of external_source_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
One
may be a subset of another . This entity may be specialized to specify such a relationship.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3

the
by which the external_source_relationship is known.

the
that characterizes the external_source_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
one of the instances of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An externally_defined_item is the identification of information that is not explicitly represented in a given exchange and that is not defined in the annotated EXPRESS schema to which the exchange conforms.
the string that specifies the identification of the referent item.

an
that contains the referent item.

An externally_defined_item_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
with an identification and description of their relationship.
The role of externally_defined_item_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
Relationships represented using this entity may be parent child relationship. Annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity specify whether or not the relationship is directed.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.

the
by which the externally_defined_item_relationship is known.

the
that characterizes the externally_defined_item_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
one of the instance of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An externally_defined_item_with_multiple_references is a type of
that allows to define additional references providing information on the context and location of the target item within the source.
a list of s defining a path to the target .
The list of references shall be unique.

An externally_defined_item_with_multiple_references is a type of that adds a list of references to provide an unambiguous path in the external data.
The inherited from the is the target for the reference list, but is excluded from the list itself. The list ends at a entity data type that explicitly references the target or that is explicitly referenced by the target.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent up on the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A pre_defined_item is the identification of information that is not explicitly represented in a given exchange but that is defined in the annotated EXPRESS schema to which the exchange conforms.
A reference to the colour 'red' without any definition of the associated red-green-blue values would be a pre_defined_item if the red-green-blue values of the colour 'red' were specified in the relevant annotated EXPRESS schema.

the
by which the pre_defined_item is known.

The acyclic_external_source_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either an
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
for which the function is searching in the
parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified name of a subtype of the
entity.

The acyclic_externally_defined_item_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either an
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
for which the function is searching in the
parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified entity name of a type of
entity.
